Art. 4.76. 
Voluntary sale 
In an amicable partition, undivided property which none of the co-heirs is able or willing to take in his or her lot, is sold by mutual agreement or at public sale.
If the co-heirs agree on this point, they may also decide to sell such property by auction, before a notary, without the participation of third parties.
If the heirs include minors or protected persons who, by virtue of article 492/1, ¤ 2, of the former Civil Code, have been declared incapable of alienating property, or other persons referred to in article 1225 of the Judicial Code, the sale nevertheless takes place as provided for in part four, book IV, chapter IV, of the Judicial Code. The same applies 
if the estate is accepted with the benefit of inventory. In all these cases, third parties are always called to the auction.
